intro: Paratrophis heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf paratrophis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, which can range from broad to narrow and may change with environmental conditions. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in spring, and it produces berries that are dispersed by animals. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
